results.title: The Badminton Horse Trials
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: A record of the three-day event at the 1962 Badminton Horse Trials, showing famous riders and their mounts in training and the preparations made for transport and stabling. Events include dressage, cross country steeple chasing and show jumping. the Queen attends and presents prizes.

results.title: The Bad society
results.brief_description: In December 1976, 16,000 people converged at the Cotter River in Canberra for the “Down to earth” festival; a conference on alternative lifestyles. In attendance were Reverend George Davies, Dr. Jim Cairns, Dr. Jim Falk as well as thousands of counter culture followers. This documentary explores the festival and the themes of politics and social change. The Philisophy of Ex Deputy Prime Minister, Dr. Jim Cairns is particularly focussed on with its emphasis on how a nation state creates a ‘bad society’ and how communal life and a counter culture lifestyle forms the only radicalism against society.

results.title: The Bad sleep well = Warui yatsu hodo yoku nemeru
results.brief_description: Kurosawa’s first feature was released under the aegis of Kurosawa’s own production company. It is an impressive tale of greed, corruption and revenge and a powerful indictment of the dark side of business and politics with distinct overtones of “Hamlet”. Stars Toshiro Mifune. Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: The Bad and the beautiful
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, John Houseman and Vincente Minnelli
results.brief_description: The Bad and the beautiful casts a sharp eye on the studio system of Hollywood and its machinations. Legendary (mythical) Hollywood producer Jonathan Shields (Kirk Douglas) is a ruthless, amoral player in the film game, who has a slew of great films to his credit and a chorus of detractors to match. Shields’ rise to fame and power is told from three perspectives - the actress, the director and the writer. Each provides the audience with extensive flashback sequences that regale a story of their dealings with Shields. In each case Shields manipulated the individual for his own ends, to the detriment of his personal relationships. Douglas plays Shields as a charming authoritarian patriarch whose humanitarian misdeeds are to be forgiven in the name of art. Purportedly based on Darryl F. Zanuck (a key Hollywood player in the 1950s and 1960s), Shields could indeed reflect any number of megalomaniac studio heads. Directed by Vincenti Minelli, the film is a lush melodrama, typical of the MGM style of the 1950s and won numerous awards including five Oscars. Also starring: Lana Tuner, Walter Pidgeon, Dick Powell, Barry Sullivan and Gloria Grahame.

results.title: The Backbone of life
results.creator_credit: Gus Mercurio Enterprises, Gus Mercurio and John Gauci
results.brief_description: Gus Mercurio has been a Registered Doctor of Chiropractic for over 35 years. These routines have enriched his own life and can do the same for you. The whole routine in 2 parts takes less than 40 minutes to complete and can be easily adapted to your day. Designed for the mature, it includes stretching and toning, low impact aerobics - walking, swimming or cycling - weight training and isometrics and relaxation. Proper sleep support and dietary advice are covered to make this tape a must for any-one suffering muscular or back discomfort.

results.title: The Back strokes
results.brief_description: A film made for the Amateur Swimming Association demonstrating the old and new methods of leg and arm action for this stoke, including a detailed comparison of bent and straight arm recovery. Photographed by G. Pocknall.

results.title: The Back of Beyond
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, John Heyer, Janet Heyer and Roland Robinson
results.brief_description: Heyer’s romantic impression of life in the inland of Australia featuring the Birdsville Track and its postman, Tom Kruse. Highlights the isolation of the people on outback stations and small towns, and the importance in their lives of the postman and the pedal wireless. Notable in the history of documentary for its strong visuals and use of natural speech, and for being the first production of the Shell Film Unit in Australia. Commentary spoken by Kevin Brennan.

results.title: The Back health program
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Occupational Health, Safety and Workers Compensation Unit and New South Wales. Technical and Further Education
results.brief_description: Amanda Gore is renowned for her work in occuaptional health. It is true that many workers will suffer from back-related health problems. The purpose of this program is to develop better back health and preventative strategies to minimise the risk of back injury. The videocassette and booklet are divided into five modules: 1. How back pain develops. 2. Sitting. 3. Lifting. 4. Preventing back injury. 5. Exercises. The three posters in the package are: 1. Guidelines for lifting. 2. Your body’s warning signs. 3. Back exercises. By following the simple and effective exercises, the risk of back injury can be reduced.

results.title: The Back-breaking leaf
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig, Tom Daly and Terence Macartney-Filgate
results.brief_description: Smokers say it’s relaxing, but tobacco harvesters call it “the back-breaking leaf.” Here is a graphic picture of the tobacco harvest in southwestern Ontario, presented from points of view of the transient field workers who move in for a brief bonanza when the leaves are ripe, and of the farmers who depend solely on this crop. A 1959 black and white production. Camera by: Terence Macartney-Filgate, Music by: Eldon Rathburn, Commentary by: Stanley Jackson. (Awards: Cannes; New York; Antwerp.)

results.title: The Baby of Macon
results.creator_credit: Channel Four, UGC Images, La Sept, Kees Kasander and Peter Greenaway
results.brief_description: Peter Greenaway’s film is visually sumptuous and confronting. Inspired by images of billboards featuring young children as icons, Greenaway’s film is set in the seventeenth century where child martyrs were similarly exploited. Rape, death, dismemberment occur when a miraculous child is the subject of a play that becomes too real. Stars Ralph Fiennes and Julia Ormond.
